contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2013}} [[File:Doris Dörrie (2007).jpg|thumb|Doris Dörrie]] '''Doris Dörrie''' (born 26 May 1955, [[Hanover]]) is a German film director, producer and author. ==Life and work== Dörrie completed her secondary education ("[[Abitur]]") at a humanist [[Gymnasium (school)|Gymnasium]]. In 1973 she began a two-year attendance in film studies, in the drama department of the [[University of the Pacific (United States)|University of the Pacific]] in [[Stockton, California]]. She then studied at the [[New School of Social Research]] in New York. She worked odd jobs in cafés and as film presenter in New York's Goethe House.<!-- is [[Goethe-Institut]] meant? --> In 1975, back in Germany, she began to study at the [[University of Television and Film Munich]], and wrote film reviews for the ''[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]'', where she was also assistant editor. Subsequently Dörrie worked as a volunteer for various television stations, and filmed short documentaries. Her numerous works of fiction, unlike her films, were greeted with a mixed reception.{{Citation needed|date=August 2011}} ==Awards== *1999 [[Bavarian Film Awards]], Best Screenplay<ref>[http://www.bayern.de/Anlage19170/PreistraegerdesBayerischenFilmpreises-Pierrot.pdf List of prize winners]</ref> *1999 [[Deutscher Filmpreis|German Film Award]] in Gold for ''Am I Beautiful?'' *2012 [[Bavarian Film Award]], Best Director<ref>IMDb. [http://www.imdb.com/event/ev0000085/2012 Bavarian Film Awards. Munich, Bavaria. Awards for 2012]</ref> ==Filmography== *1985: ''[[Men…]]'' (''Männer…'') *1989: ''Money'' (''[[:de:Geld (Film)|Geld]]'') *1989: ''[[Me and Him]]'' (''[[:de:Ich und Er|Ich und Er]]''), starring [[Griffin Dunne]], [[Ellen Greene]], [[Kelly Bishop]], [[Carey Lowell]] *1992: ''[[:de:Happy Birthday, Türke! (Film)|Happy Birthday, Türke]]'', starring [[:de:Hansa Czypionka|Hansa Czypionka]], [[Meret Becker]], [[Joachim Król]] *1994: ''Nobody Loves Me'' (''[[:de:Keiner liebt mich|Keiner liebt mich]]'') *1998: ''Am I Beautiful?'' (''[[:de:Bin ich schön?|Bin ich schön?]]''), starring [[Franka Potente]], [[Uwe Ochsenknecht]] *2002: ''[[Enlightenment Guaranteed]]'' (''Erleuchtung garantiert'') *2002: ''Naked'' (''[[:de:Nackt (2002)|Nackt]]'') *2007: ''[[:de:How to Cook Your Life|How to Cook Your Life]]'', a documentary about [[Zen]] [[chef]] [[Edward Espe Brown]] *2008: ''[[Cherry Blossoms (film)|Cherry Blossoms]]'' (''Kirschblüten – Hanami'') *2010: ''The [[Wikt:coiffeuse|Coiffeuse]]'' (''[[:de:Die Friseuse|Die Friseuse]]'') *2012: ''Bliss'' (''[[:de:Glück (2012)|Glück]]'') ==References== *Breitenstein, Andreas. "Alptraum vom Traummann: Doris Dörries Erzählung ''Der Mann meiner Träume''." ''Neue Zürcher Zeitung'' (22 July 1991). *Elss, Karin. "Doris Dörrie als Erzählerin." ''[[Saarbrücker Zeitung]]'' (24 August 1989). *Görtz, Franz Josef. "Beiläufige Tragödien: Geschichten von der Filmemacherin Doris Dörrie." ''Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung'' (14 March 1989). *Joglekar, Yogini. "Ethnic Noir in Post-Wall Germany: ''Happy Birthday, Türke!'' (Dörrie 1991)." ''CLUES: A Journal of Detection'' 24.2 (Winter 2006): 17–29. *Jurczyk, Günther. "Brav Geschmollt: Doris Dörrie erzählt." ''Stuttgarter Zeitung'' (11 October 1989). *Phillips, Klaus. "A Conversation with Doris Dörrie." In: ''Straight Through the Heart: Doris Dörrie, German Filmmaker and Author'', ed. Franz Birgel, Klaus Phillips and Christian-Albrecht Gollub. Lanham: Scarecrow Press, 2004. pp. 1–16. *Steuhl, Wolfgang. "Antonia und der Dreckspatz: Wenn ein Mannequin den Mann ihrer Träume findet." ''Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung'' (13 April 1991). *Utz, Richard. "Reflecting Love at Quite Its Natural Size: Doris Dörrie as a Writer." In: ''Straight Through the Heart: Doris Dörrie, German Filmmaker and Author'', ed. Franz Birgel, Klaus Phillips and Christian-Albrecht Gollub. Lanham: Scarecrow Press, 2004. pp. 177–87. ==Footnotes== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} * {{IMDb name|id=0246903}} * [http://www.virtual-history.com/movie/person/6309/doris-doerrie Literature on Doris Dörrie] {{Authority control|VIAF=112341402}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dorrie, Doris | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =German film director | DATE OF BIRTH =26 May 1955 | PLACE OF BIRTH =Hanover, Germany | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dorrie, Doris}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Female film directors]] [[Category:German film directors]] [[Category:German-language film directors]] [[Category:German screenwriters]] [[Category:Women screenwriters]] [[Category:University of the Pacific (United States) alumni]] [[Category:University of Television and Film Munich alumni]]
